[ICON_FOOD] Food is what determines the number of soldiers that your army can sustain. The more food is produced by your nation, the faster your reserve of personnel will be filled.
[ICON_GOLD] Gold is stockpiled in the national treasury. It may be used to purchase items in Cities, sustain your infrastructure, and as leverage in Diplomacy.
With [ICON_GOLD] Gold you may purchase units and buildings in your cities, sustain your infrastructure, and use it as leverage in Diplomacy.

Convert 75% of [ICON_GOLD] gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] production to materiel for reinforcements.
[ICON_MATERIEL] Materiel are needed to reinforce your units after they have taken damage in combat. Depending of the unit type, more or less materiel will be needed.
[ICON_PERSONNEL] Personnel are needed to reinforce your units after they have taken casualties in combat. Depending of the unit type, more or less personnel will be needed.

A total conversion wargame based on the Civ5 game engine which features hundreds of new Units, Frontlines, Supply lines, Reinforcements, Convoys...

Welcome to R.E.D WWII HotSeat Edition. Click the continue button to start your game. You can save before each player turn, or from the game menu. To reload a hotseat game, you must use the hotseat loading screen from the custom setup menu. Have a good game and report bugs on civfanatics, thanx.

Welcome to R.E.D WWII HotSeat Edition. To initialize your hotseat game, you'll have to manually pass the login screen of "player 1" which is a dummy player used to fix an issue with hotseat and WB scenario loading. You'll have to do this only once at game first turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You'll be able to save before each player turn, or from the game menu. To reload a hotseat game, you must use the hotseat loading screen from the custom setup menu.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Have a good game and report bugs on civfanatics, thanx.

Author: Gedemon[NEWLINE]Size: [COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE_TEXT]Huge[/COLOR] (min. 4GB RAM)[NEWLINE]Stability: [COLOR_GREEN]Stable[/COLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Take control of France, United Kingdom, U.S.S.R, Italy, Greece or Germany in Europe from 1939 to 1945.

Take control of France, United Kingdom, U.S.S.R, Italy, Greece or Germany in Europe from 1939 to 1945.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The game will finish when one side has lost all it's key cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Here's the list of objectives by nations :[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] United Kingdom : London, Liverpool, Edinburgh, Newcastle.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] France : Paris, Caen, Bordeaux, Dunkerque.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] U.S.S.R. : Moscow, Stalingrad, Kiev, Leningrad.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Germany : Berlin, Kiel, Bremen, Frankfurt.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Italy : Rome, Naples, Milan, Bologne.

Author: Gedemon[NEWLINE]Size: [COLOR_GREEN]Tiny[/COLOR][NEWLINE]Stability: [COLOR_GREEN]Stable[/COLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lead Soviet or German troops to victory during the battle of Stalingrad, with fully working objectives.

Take control of Soviet or German troops during the battle of Stalingrad.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As Germany you must preserve your 6th Army, gain control of Stalingrad and keep your supply lines from the west and south open.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As U.S.S.R. retake Stalingrad if you lose it, destroy German's 6th Army and close the pincer at Kalash using your reinforcements.

Take control of Soviet or German troops during the battle of Stalingrad.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As Germany you must preserve your 6th Army, gain control of Stalingrad and keep your supply lines from the west and south open.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As U.S.S.R. retake Stalingrad if you lose it, destroy German's 6th Army and close the pincer at Kalash using your reinforcements.

Author: T_KCommanderbly[NEWLINE]Size: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Giant[/COLOR] (8GB RAM/quad CPU)[NEWLINE]Stability: [COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE_TEXT]Crashes possible due to size[/COLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from eight nations during World War II. Fight on the Axis and try to dominate the world or fight on the Allies and try to save it.

The Following eight nations are on these teams:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_BLUE]Allies[/COLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]United Kingdom[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]France[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]U.S.S.R[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]United States of America[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Nationalist China[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Axis[/COLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Germany[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Italy[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Japan.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Note: If you are a skilled player you may want to play as France, Nationalist China or Italy. If you are a new player you may want to play as the United States or the United Kingdom.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Also Note: If you are looking for lots of action play as Germany, Japan or the Soviet Union.

Author: T_KCommanderbly[NEWLINE]Size: [COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE_TEXT]Huge[/COLOR] (min. 4GB RAM)[NEWLINE]Stability: [COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE_TEXT]Beta / Deprecated[/COLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Experience a combined eastern seaboad and European map, build up your army and play the historical events as they unfold into all out world war.

Extra information for each civilization: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CYAN]France:[/COLOR] surrounded by Allies and friendly minor nations, France has quick access to strong tanks and a strong economy. But France's production is rather low and military rather small. [ICON_BULLET][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_BLUE]United Kingdom:[/COLOR] protected largely by a sea barrier, the United Kindom has the strongest starting navy and a very strong strategic foothold on the world. However the UK's economy is struggling from the commonwealth and has a small starting army. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RED]U.S.S.R:[/COLOR] the largest nation by land the Soviet Union has both the largest starting army and access to the strongest tanks in the game. But the Soviet's also lack a good infrastructure and a navy. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_BLUE]The United States:[/COLOR] seperated by the atlantic ocean from Europe the USA has the best production in the game and a very strong economy. But the USA has a small starting army and air force. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREY]Germany:[/COLOR] a strong military power, Germany has both the strongest army and air force in the game. But Germany is surrounded by enemies and starts out with a low score. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Italy:[/COLOR] at the center of the map, Italy has a strong starting navy and strategic position. But Italy has a small economy and a low production.

Author: T_KCommanderbly[NEWLINE]Size: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Giant[/COLOR] (8GB RAM/quad CPU)[NEWLINE]Stability: [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Alpha (Experimental release)[/COLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Experience a giant Earth map set in 1936, build up your economy, production and army while events unfold into the deadliest war in human history.

Civilization Information: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]France:[/COLOR][NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL]Try to hold off against the Axis until the Soviet Union can join the war (June 1941) creating two fronts. Losing Paris will result in the overthrow of your government so keep it at all costs.[NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]Recieve Convoys from Controlling Indochina and recieve free Convoys from America.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]France has strong early tanks and access to the foreign legion unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_BLUE]United Kingdom:[/COLOR][NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL]Surrounded by water it is important for the British to establish naval and air dominance. Keeping the Axis away from the Suez is also essential for winning the war.[NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]Recieve Convoys from Controlling Hong Kong, Singapore and Bombay while also recieving free convoys from America, Canada and Australia. Keeping sea lanes open is essential to success and controlling the Suez will help make Convoys arrive faster.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]The UK has the strongest navy and has access to powerful air units. Most British tanks are built for speed and open ground not strength.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RED]U.S.S.R:[/COLOR] [NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL]If France should fall, it is essential to hold out against Germany consuming as much of their personal and material as possible. Relying on the western Allies will bring mixed results however it is most important to out endure Germany this will eventually lead to winning the war on the eastern front. [NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]If a road or railroad is controlled from the City of Murmansk to Moscow then you will recieve convoys from America. You also will recieve free convoys from the west coast of America.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]The Soviets have access to very strong tanks, with their UA it is also essential to create as many Infantry Divisions as your economy can handle.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_BLUE]The United States:[/COLOR] [NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL]As America it is important to harness production and supply the Allies with as much aircraft, ships and tanks as possible. Keeping the Soviet Union, United Kingdom and Australia alive at all costs is essential to keeping the Axis from invading the Americas.[NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]The Americans recieve free convoys from Brazil and Australia. Controlling Panama will also give you a convoy.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]The Americans production level allows them to create tanks, aircraft and ships at a rate capable of tripling the Axis's combined production rate. Though weak at the beginning American aircraft is strong in the late game, especially it's bombers. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREY]Germany:[/COLOR] [NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL]As Germany it is important to defeat enemies quickly before they can stop your advance, letting them live too long will be fatel especially when attacking the Soviet Union. Keeping allied convoys from reaching their destination is essential to starving out nations like the United Kingdom.[NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]The German's recieve convoys from Sweden, Finland and Norway so long as it isn't winter.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]The Germans have strong tanks and aircraft. The blitz promotion means creating a combined air, armored and infantry attack on the enemy is always the best strategy to defeating enemies quickly.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Italy:[/COLOR] [NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL] As Italy it is important to keep pressure on France and as well as capturing the Suez Canal in order to slow convoys going to Britain. Italy has a strong ally in the north but it is Italy's job to protect the Axis's southern borders. [NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]Italy doesn't recieve convoys, controlling the Suez however will slow Allied convoys.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]Italy doesn't have a strong military advantage but it's strategic location allows them to protect it's holdings easier. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WHITE]Greece[/COLOR] [NEWLINE] [ICON_CAPITAL]Much like France, it is important to hold off the Axis advance as Greece until other allied countries join the war relieving pressure so an offensive is possible.[NEWLINE] [ICON_GOLD]The Greeks do not recieve convoys however helping to protect the Suez will allow easy access of Allied convoys.[NEWLINE] [ICON_STRENGTH]The Greeks do not possess any military strength's however the many choke points around Greece give them an advantage when defending.

General, France has been the center of the world of culture and arts for centuries, we are one of the few countries to be a standing Democracy and our military stands as the most modernized in the world. After the Great War ("La Der des Ders" as we thougth then) our nation had to rebuild herself, but just after we were plunged into the world depression and now things get worse as acts of agression increase in Europe and the Pacific. Now the world looks to our power to counter the rise of facism and the ideals of militarism.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As peace is more and more uncertain, the people of France have chosen you to be their leader in these hard times. Can you General lead France to repel the Facist agression, can you make this war to come to truly be "the Last of the Last" ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

The Invasion of Poland caused France and Britain to declare war against Germany. But the Allies did not launch massive assaults and kept a defensive stance: this was called the Phoney War in Britain or Drôle de guerre—the funny sort of war—in France. It did not prevent the German army from conquering Poland in a matter of weeks with its innovative Blitzkrieg tactics and helped by the Soviet Union's attack on Poland. When Germany had its hands free for an attack in the west, the Battle of France began in May 1940, and the same tactics proved just as devastating there. The Wehrmacht bypassed the Maginot Line by marching through the Ardennes forest. A second German force was sent into Belgium and the Netherlands to act as a diversion to this main thrust. In six weeks of savage fighting the French lost 90,000 men. Many civilians sought refuge by taking to the roads of France: some two million refugees from Belgium and Holland were joined by between eight and ten million French civilians, representing a quarter of the French population, all heading south and west. This movement may well have been the largest single movement of civilians in history prior to 1947.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

French leaders surrendered to Nazi Germany on 24 June 1940, after the British Expeditionary Force was evacuated from Dunkirk. Nazi Germany occupied three fifths of France's territory, leaving the rest in the southeast to the new Vichy government. This regime sought to collaborate with Germany. It was established on 10 July 1940. The Vichy Regime was led by Philippe Pétain, the aging war hero of First World war. It was originally intended to be a temporary, care-taker regime, to supervise French administration before the soon-expected defeat of Britain. Instead, it lasted four years. It was unique among the various collaborating regimes of wartime Europe in that it was established constitutionally, through the French parliament. However, Charles de Gaulle declared himself on Radio Londres the head of a rival government in exile, gathering the Free French Forces around him, finding support in some French colonies and recognition from Britain and the USA.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Vichy regime adopted violent, repressive anti-semitic policies on its own initiative, without direction from Nazi Germany. During the German occupation 76,000 Jews would be deported, often with the help of the Vichy French authorities, and murdered in the Nazis' extermination camps. After the Attack on Mers-el-Kébir in 1940, where the British fleet destroyed a large part of the French navy, still under command of Vichy France, that killed about 1,100 sailors, there was nationwide indignation and a feeling of distrust in the French forces, leading to the events of the Battle of Dakar. Eventually, several important French ships such as the Richelieu and the Surcouf joined the Free French Forces. On the Eastern Front the USSR was lacking pilots and several French pilots joined the Soviet Union and fought the Luftwaffe in the Normandie-Niemen squadron. Within France proper, very few people organized themselves against the German Occupation in the summer of 1940. However, their numbers grew as the Vichy regime resorted to more strident policies in order to fulfill the enormous demands of the Nazis and the eventual decline of Nazi Germany became more obvious. Isolated opposers eventually formed a real movement: the Resistance. There were also Frenchmen who joined the SS, they were known as the Charlemagne Division; knowing they would not survive should Germany be defeated, they were among the last ones to surrender at Berlin.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In November 1942 Vichy France was finally occupied by German forces, because the war in North Africa was coming to an end; the Germans foresaw a threat in southern Europe by the allied forces.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

On 6 June 1944 the Allies landed in Normandy while on 15 August they landed in Provence (including the 260,000 men of the French army B). General Leclerc freed Paris and Strasbourg and later, along with the battleship Richelieu, represented France at Tokyo during the Japanese surrender.

Mein Führer, After World War I, we were humiliated by the betrayal of our own leaders and treated harshly by the Treaty of Versaille. The Weimer Republic has failed and has driven us into economic disaster. After turmoil and bad leadership, you have finally risen to power. Already you have turned our country around into a new glorious empire, The Third Reich, by defying the Treaty of Versaille and solving Germany's economic issues.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Fatherland has always been a great nation, our military the best in the world, our generals unmatched and our industrial might unseen. Mein Führer, can you lead the German People to complete world domination, can you give them "das tausendjährige Reich" you've promised ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

In 1935, Germany reacquired control of the Saar and in 1936 military control of the Rhineland, both of which had been lost in the Treaty of Versailles. In 1938 and 1939, Austria and Czechoslovakia were brought under German control and the invasion of Poland was prepared through the Molotov–Ribbentrop pact and Operation Himmler. On 1 September 1939 the German Wehrmacht launched a blitzkrieg on Poland, which was swiftly occupied by Germany and by the Soviet Red Army. The UK and France declared war on Germany, marking the beginning of World War II.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] As the war progressed, Germany and its allies quickly gained control of much of continental Europe while the plan to occupy the United Kingdom failed. On 22 June 1941, Germany broke the Molotov–Ribbentrop pact and invaded the Soviet Union. The same year, Japan attacked the American base at Pearl Harbor, and Germany declared war on the United States. The Battle of Stalingrad forced the German army to retreat on the Eastern front. In September 1943, Germany's ally Italy surrendered, and German troops were forced to defend an additional front in Italy. D-Day opened a Western front, as Allied forces advanced towards German territory. On 8 May 1945, the German armed forces surrendered after the Red Army occupied Berlin.

Prime Minister, the British Empire has been the largest and most powerful on the face of the earth for centuries. We have been the protector of Democracy and the leading humitarian country of the world, our military might has gone unmatched for a long time. But many nations have grown up to challenge what we stand for and what we see right. The costly victory during World War I and the depression the world has slipped into has tremendously damaged our great economy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]However the people have elected you as the war menace is growing in Europe, relying on your leadership and strength to stand up against militarism and facism. Can you Prime Minister defeat the aggressors and get us out of this depression, can you prevent the fall of our Empire against all odds ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

The United Kingdom, along with the British Empire's crown colonies, especially British India, declared war on Nazi Germany in 1939, after the German invasion of Poland. Hostilities with Japan began in 1941, after it attacked British colonies in Asia. Following the defeat of its European allies, in the first year of the war, the United Kingdom continued the fight against Germany which took form with notable periods such as the Battle of Britain and the Battle of the Atlantic. Following the D-Day landings and the subsequent defeat of Germany and her allies, the UK was one of the "Big Three" that met at the end of the war to plan the postwar world. The war left the United Kingdom financially damaged although aid from the Marshall Plan and loans taken from both the United States and Canada helped the UK on the road to recovery.

Duce, After the costly victory during World War I, our government went into turmoil and fearing a Communist uprising they installed you to power. Taking immediate action, you have eliminated all opposition and have becomed the first Fascist leader in Europe. The people of Italy have gotten weary of your rule and are upset by the hard economic times that have come upon them, however you have promised them a New Roman empire and defying the League of Nations you have already invaded Eithopia, first to fall under our domination.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For centuries we were the most important empire in the West and the hard working Italian people look to you to establish back their glory. Duce, can you restore a powerful Empire, can you make Rome the center of the world once again ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

In 1935, Mussolini invaded Ethiopia, resulting in an international alienation and leading to Italy's withdrawal from the League of Nations. Consequently, Italy allied with Nazi Germany and Empire of Japan and strongly supported Franco in the Spanish civil war. In 1939, Italy occupied Albania, a de facto protectorate for decades, and entered World War II in 1940 on the side of the Axis powers. Mussolini, wanting a quick victory like Hitler's Blitzkriegs in Poland and France, invaded Greece in October 1940 but was forced to accept a humiliating stalemate after a few months. At the same time, Italy, after initially conquering British Somalia and parts of Egypt, saw an allied counter-attack lead to the loss of all possessions in the Horn of Africa and in North Africa.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Italy was then invaded by the Allies in July 1943, leading to the collapse of the Fascist regime and the fall of Mussolini. In September 1943, Italy surrendered. The country remained a battlefield for the rest of the war, as the allies were moving up from the south as the north was the base for loyalist Italian fascist and German Nazi forces, fought also by the Italian resistance movement.The hostilities ended on 2 May 1945. Nearly half a million Italians (including civilians) died in the conflict, and the Italian economy had been all but destroyed; per capita income in 1944 was at its lowest point since the beginning of the 20th century.

However our nation has now to defeat Facism and the evil influences of the West to become the superpower it is meant to be.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The people of the glorious Soviet Union have recognized you as the absolute authority to lead them to victory against the capitalist and fascist menace. Can you comrade show the world the power of our socialist government, spreading our communist ideals all over the world, can you make us the true victorious power of the war to come ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

In 1938, after the United Kingdom and France had concluded the Munich Agreement with Germany, the USSR dealt with the Nazis as well, both militarily and economically during extensive talks. The two countries concluded the German–Soviet Nonaggression Pact and the German–Soviet Commercial Agreement. The nonaggression pact made possible Soviet occupation of Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, Bessarabia, northern Bukovina, and eastern Poland. In late November of the same year, unable to coerce the Republic of Finland by diplomatic means into moving its border 25 kilometres (16 mi) back from Leningrad, Joseph Stalin ordered the invasion of Finland.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In the east, the Soviet military won several decisive victories during border clashes with the Japanese Empire in 1938 and 1939. However, in April 1941, USSR signed the Soviet–Japanese Neutrality Pact with the Empire of Japan, recognizing the territorial integrity of Manchukuo, a Japanese puppet state.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Although it has been debated whether the Soviet Union had any intention of invading Germany once it was strong enough, Germany itself broke the treaty and invaded the Soviet Union on 22 June 1941, starting what was known in the USSR as the "Great Patriotic War". The Red Army stopped the seemingly-invincible German Army at the Battle of Moscow, aided by an unusually harsh winter. The Battle of Stalingrad, which lasted from late 1942 to early 1943, dealt a severe blow to the Germans from which they never fully recovered and became a turning point of the war. After Stalingrad, Soviet forces drove through Eastern Europe to Berlin before Germany surrendered in 1945.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The same year, the USSR, in fulfillment of its agreement with the Allies at the Yalta Conference, denounced the Soviet–Japanese Neutrality Pact in April 1945 and invaded Manchukuo and other Japan-controlled territories on 9 August 1945. This conflict ended with a decisive Soviet victory, contributing to the unconditional surrender of Japan and the end of World War II.

Arkhigos Metaxas, Hellas lives dark days, we are the fathers of the western civilization and now after more than 10,000 years of existance our country is under one of the biggest threat it has known. The first world war has left deep wounds in every aspect of our nation, our army equipment is obsolete, and none of our frontiers is safe. But the Hellines never learned the word "surrender", our defenders won't be our guns but the well know courage and honor of the Hellenic armies who have protected our nation for all these centuries. Metaxas, the sons of the Spartans and Alexander the Great are waiting for you to lead them, but will it be to victory or to a honorable death, to another Marathon or to another Thermopylae ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

Despite the country's numerically small and ill-equipped armed forces, Greece made a decisive contribution to the Allied efforts in World War II. At the start of the war Greece sided with the Allies and refused to give in to Mussolini ultimatum demanding occupation rights to strategic Greek sites. When the Italian envoy presented these demands on 28 October 1940 to the Greek prime Minister Metaxas, he was met with a curt reply: "Alors, c'est la guerre" ("then it is war"). Italy invaded Greece by way of Albania on 28 October 1940, but Greek troops repelled the invaders after a bitter struggle. This marked the first Allied victory in the war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Primarily to secure his strategic southern flank, German dictator Adolf Hitler reluctantly stepped in and launched the Battle of Greece. Troops from Germany, Bulgaria, and Italy successfully invaded Greece, through Yugoslavia, overcoming Greek, British, Australian, and New Zealand units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] On 20 May 1941, the Germans attempted to seize Crete with a large attack by paratroops—with the aim of reducing the threat of a counter-offensive by Allied forces in Egypt—but faced heavy resistance. The Greek campaign might have delayed German military plans against Soviet Union and the heavy losses of German paratroopers led the Germans to launch no further large-scale air-invasions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] During the years of Occupation of Greece by Nazi Germany, thousands of Greeks died in direct combat, in concentration camps, or of starvation. The occupiers murdered the greater part of the Jewish community despite efforts by the Greek Orthodox Church and many other Christian Greeks to shelter the Jews. The economy of Greece was devastated.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] When the Soviet Army began its drive across Romania in August 1944, the German Army in Greece began withdrawing north and northwestward from Greece into Yugoslavia and Albania to avoid being cut off in Greece. Hence, the German occupation of Greece ended in October 1944. British troops landed on 4 October in Patras, and entered Athens at October 13.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] During the period between 1942 and 1944, known as the first phase of the greek civil wars, marxist and non-Marxist resistance groups fought each other in a fratricidal conflict to establish the leadership of the Greek resistance movement. In the second phase (1944) the ascendant communists, in military control of most of Greece, confronted the returning Greek government in exile, which had been formed under Western Allied auspices in Cairo and originally included six KKE-affiliated ministers. In the third phase (commonly called the "Third Round" by the Communists) (1946–1949), guerrilla forces controlled by KKE fought against the internationally recognized Greek Government which was formed after elections boycotted by KKE.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The civil war left Greece with a legacy of political polarization; as a result, Greece also entered into alliance with the United States and joined NATO, while relationships with its Communist northern neighbours, both pro-Soviet and neutral, became strained.

Mr. President, After the victory of World War I, we entered an economic boom becoming the largest economic country in the world. However our nation in the past decade has entered a Great Depression creating havoc for the American people and the American economy. They then elected you to lead them through the depression and hard economic times. You let them have a New Deal giving many Americans jobs and hope for a good future however the nation was still stung deeply by the Depression.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But The storm clouds in Europe are brewing once again and the American people have elected you to find away to stay out of the conflict. Can you Mr. President redeem the American economy, can you free the world of Facism and Communism, can you become a super power...?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Army:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CITY_BLUE]Navy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_RESEARCH_RATE]Air Force:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Economy:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YIELD_PRODUCTION]Production:[/COLOR][TAB] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_RATE]Diplomatic Situation:[/COLOR] [ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL][ICON_CAPITAL]

A veteran of World War I, in the 1920s and 1930s de Gaulle came to the fore as a proponent of mobile armoured divisions, which he considered would become central in modern warfare. During World War II, he reached the temporary rank of Brigadier General, leading one of the few successful armoured counter-attacks during the 1940 Battle of France, and then briefly served in the French government as France was falling.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] He escaped to Britain and gave a famous radio address, broadcast by the BBC on 18 June 1940, exhorting the French people to resist Nazi Germany and organised the Free French Forces with exiled French officers in Britain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] He gradually obtained control of all French colonies except Indochina—most of which had at first been controlled by the pro-German Vichy regime—and by the time of the liberation of France in 1944 he was heading a government in exile, insisting that France be treated as an independent great power by the other Allies. De Gaulle became prime minister in the French Provisional Government, resigning in 1946 due to political conflicts.('from Wikipedia')

Adolf Hitler was an Austrian-born German politician and the leader of the National Socialist German Workers Party, commonly known as the Nazi Party. He was Chancellor of Germany from 1933 to 1945 and, after 1934, also head of state as Führer und Reichskanzler, ruling the country as an absolute dictator.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] A decorated veteran of World War I, Hitler joined the precursor of the Nazi Party (NSDAP) in 1919 and became leader of NSDAP in 1921. He attempted a failed coup called the Beer Hall Putsch in Munich in 1923, for which he was imprisoned. Following his imprisonment, in which he wrote Mein Kampf, he gained support by promoting German nationalism, anti-semitism, anti-capitalism, and anti-communism with charismatic oratory and propaganda. He was appointed chancellor in 1933, and quickly transformed the Weimar Republic into the Third Reich, a single-party dictatorship based on the totalitarian and autocratic ideals of national socialism.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Hitler ultimately wanted to establish a New Order of absolute Nazi German hegemony in continental Europe. To achieve this, he pursued a foreign policy with the declared goal of seizing Lebensraum for the Aryan people; directing the resources of the state towards this goal. This included the rearmament of Germany, which culminated in 1939 when the Wehrmacht invaded Poland. In response, the United Kingdom and France declared war against Germany, leading to the outbreak of World War II in Europe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Within three years, Germany and the Axis powers had occupied most of Europe, and most of Northern Africa, East and Southeast Asia and the Pacific Ocean. However, with the reversal of the Nazi invasion of the Soviet Union, the Allies gained the upper hand from 1942 onwards. By 1945, Allied armies had invaded German-held Europe from all sides. Nazi forces engaged in numerous violent acts during the war, including the systematic murder of as many as 17 million civilians, including an estimated six million Jews targeted in the Holocaust and between 500,000 and 1,500,000 Roma, Poles, Soviet civilians, Soviet prisoners of war, people with disabilities, homosexuals, Jehovah's Witnesses, and other political and religious opponents.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In the final days of the war, during the Battle of Berlin in 1945, Hitler married his long-time mistress Eva Braun and, to avoid capture by Soviet forces less than two days later, the two committed suicide on 30 April 1945. ('from Wikipedia')

Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill, (30 November 1874 - 24 January 1965) was a British politician and statesman known for his leadership of the United Kingdom during the Second World War. He is widely regarded as one of the great wartime leaders. He served as Prime Minister twice (1940–45 and 1951–55). A noted statesman and orator, Churchill was also an officer in the British Army, a historian, a writer, and an artist. To date, he is the only British prime minister to have received the Nobel Prize in Literature, and he was the first person to be made an honorary citizen of the United States. ('from Wikipedia')

Mussolini became the 40th Prime Minister of Italy in 1922 and began using the title Il Duce by 1925. After 1936, his official title was "His Excellency Benito Mussolini, Head of Government, Duce of Fascism, and Founder of the Empire". Mussolini also created and held the supreme military rank of First Marshal of the Empire along with King Victor Emmanuel III of Italy, which gave him and the King joint supreme control over the military of Italy. Mussolini remained in power until he was replaced in 1943; for a short period after this until his death, he was the leader of the Italian Social Republic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Mussolini was among the founders of Italian Fascism, which included elements of nationalism, corporatism, national syndicalism, expansionism, social progress, and anti-socialism in combination with censorship of subversives and state propaganda. In the years following his creation of the Fascist ideology, Mussolini influenced, or achieved admiration from, a wide variety of political figures. ('from Wikipedia')

Joseph Vissarionovich Stalin (18 December 1878 - 5 March 1953) was a Georgian-born, Soviet politician and Bolshevik revolutionary, who held the position of first General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union's Central Committee from 1922 until his death in 1953. While formally the office of the General Secretary was elective and was not initially regarded as the top position in the Soviet state, after Vladimir Lenin's death in 1924, Stalin managed to consolidate more and more power in his hands, gradually putting down all opposition groups within the party. This included Leon Trotsky, the Red Army organizer, proponent of world revolution, and principal critic of Stalin among the early Soviet leaders, who was exiled from the Soviet Union in 1929. Instead, Stalin's idea of socialism in one country became the primary line of the Soviet politics. ('from Wikipedia')
General Secretary of the Communist Party

Born in 1871 in Ithaki, Ioannis Metaxas was a high army officer who in 1936 was appointed prime minister by the king George II and later on took total power, saving Greece from an economic collapse and successfully equipping 800,000 troops instead of the 200,000 Greece could arm before him. He also achieved to unit the divided Hellenic people under his dictatorship and led them to great victories against the axis. Metaxas died in Athens on January 29, 1941 from a toxaemia, before the German invasion of Greece.

Replace.Text: Howitzers fire projectiles at relatively high trajectories, with a steep angle of descent, making them usefull against fortified positions and cities defense, while allowing indirect fire above obstacle. Their HE ammo give them a bonus against infantry units. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit.

Field Guns fire smaller shells with higher velocities and flatter trajectories than Howitzers. Combined with armor-piercing ammo they can inflict great casualties on armor units. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit.

Anti-Aircraft Artillery are guns with a high muzzle velocity (allowing the projectiles to reach greater altitudes) and a high rate of fire, that can also be used defensively against armor units. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit and will protect it from enemy aircraft.
Aircraft specialized in bombarding enemy targets. Strong against Cities, they lack precision when bombing Units.
Battleships are the most powerful naval units, but they can be severely damaged by torpedoes attacks from submarines or small bombers.
Armored and fast moving units, the tanks are feared on the battlefield but they need a lot more support in material than infantry units.

Strong infantry Unit capable of paradropping from friendly cities. Paratrooper ignore terrain movement cost, but their light equipement make them weak against armor units. They can move after paradroping, but cannot enter combat until the following turn. You can only have five (ten for Germany) active units of this type deployed on the battlefield at the same time.
Fast moving infantry unit.
The backbone of any army, the infantry units don't need a lot of resources and can be used successfully to defend your ground in rough terrain and capture enemy cities.

Fast Bombers are small twin-engines bombers with good speed, making them difficult to intercept. More precise against units than bigger bombers, they also deal less damage to cities.
Jet-powered bombers with very high speed, making them nearly impossible to intercept.
Long range and well armed bombers with large payload that can deal a lot of damage to cities, but very imprecise against units.

Sturdier but less manoeuvrable, the Fighter-Bomber can engage all type of units on all domains. They don't have the same readiness level as normal Fighters and can't be used intensively for interception.
Twin-engines fighters with bigger payload and better range than normal fighters. They are polyvalent and can be used for enemy bomber's interception, reconnaissance missions or ground attack runs.
Light aircrafts used for ground attack, they have a short range and are weak to enemy fighters, but they are your best choice to safely take out enemy armored vehicules.

Light Bombers are small twin-engines bombers with good maneuverability and an armament designed to be effective against ground units. They deal less damage to cities than normal bombers, and are weak against enemy fighters.

Light Bombers are small twin-engines bombers with good maneuverability and an armament designed to be effective against ground units. They deal less damage to cities than normal bombers, and are weak against enemy fighters. Those models are designed to be based on aircraft carrier.
Light aircrafts used for ground and naval attack, they have a short range and are weak to enemy fighters. Those models are designed to be based on aircraft carrier.

Light embarked aircrafts used for naval attack, they are very good against even the biggest battleships, but they have a short range and are very weak to enemy fighters due to their poor maneuverability. Those models are designed to be based on aircraft carrier.

Gun or howitzer mounted on a motor vehicle or armored chassis, designed for use when attacking fortified positions. Strong against cities and fortified infantries, they can also be used succesfully against other armors, but are slow and weak in defense. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit.

Large and heavy assault guns, they are deadly against cities and fortified infantries, are feared by other armors, but are very slow and weaker in defense. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit.

Anti-tank guns mounted on wheeled or tracked chassis, generally using ambush to counter enemy tanks. They have lower mobility than tanks, and can't be used on attack. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit and will protect it from enemy armored units.

Anti-tank guns mounted on an armored chassis, generally using ambush to counter enemy tanks. They have lower mobility than tanks, and can't be used on attack. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit and will protect it from enemy armored units.

Large and heavy armored tank destroyers, they are lethal for other tanks. They have low mobility, can't be used on attack and drain resources heavily. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit and will protect it from enemy armored units.
Large and heavy armored tanks, they are very strong but slow and drain a lot of resources to be operational. Their size make them easy targets for air attacks.
Giant tanks, they are very strong but also very slow and drain a lot of resources to be operational. Their size make them easy targets for air attacks.

Cruiser tanks (also called cavalry tanks) are very fast moving tanks that can take advantage of gaps in the enemy front to cut it's supply lines. Lightly armed and lightly armored for better speed, they are no match for other tanks and weak in defense.
Light armored and fast moving tanks, needing less resources than normal tanks, good against infantry or for scouting.
Smaller than Battleships but larger than Destroyers, Cruisers have a well balanced combination of speed, range and firepower.
Heavy Cruisers are designed for long range mission, they move fast and are well armed with naval guns of roughly 203mm calibre.
Obsolete Battleships or Battlecruisers, they lack speed and are outclassed by modern battleships, but their heavy armament is still a threat for any other ships.

Special Forces are elite soldiers who can paradrop from friendly cities, hide in forest/jungle and ignore terrain movement cost. They do not take damage when attacking (ranged combat) and can withdraw from melee combat when defending. They do not capture enemy territory or cities, and you can only have one (three for U.K.) active unit of this type deployed on the battlefield at the same time. This regiment-sized unit can stack with a Division unit.
Slow moving tanks with decent armor designed to support the infantry in trench warfare, the light infantry tanks are good against fortified units and in defense.
Slow moving tanks with decent armor designed to support the infantry in trench warfare, the infantry tanks are good against fortified units and in defense.

The French Military lacks a modern heavy tank like many other neighboring nations, but our engineers now have plans ready for a new design.
Our Air Force lacks a modern fighter plane, we believe this design could be one of the solution.
Our Air Force lacks a modern fighter plane, we believe this design could be one of the possible solution.
Our nation still lack a competitive modern fighter, this time we strongly agree that the proposed design is the solution.
This excellent tank design is a top priority project.
Our engineers have a project to mount the powerfull F-34 76.2 mm gun on the T-34.
An Upgraded T-34 fitted with a better gun and a larger 3 man turret.
Our engineers have designed a powerful heavy tank to add in our arsenal, that, we believe, may be superior even to the French char B1.
Our Engineers are ready to create a heavy tank design that will be able to counter Germany heavy armor and firepower.
Our Engineers are ready to upgrade the IS-1 with a 122mm Gun and double-baffle muzzle brake.
Our enginers have plans for a KV-1 equiped with a 152 mm howitzer, this design will be perfect to assault enemy fortifications and cities.
This project is the first available modern fighter design for USSR.
An evolution of the LaGG-3 design.
An evolution of the La-5 design.
An evolution of the La-5 design.
Our Engineers are ready to create a two seat close support fighter.
The German Ju 87 has proved it's value during the Spanish civil war, we may need a plane like it (but sturdier) to counter enemy armored units.
This high speed aircraft has a greater bomb load than the PE-2 and will even more likely evade interception.
We have no modern battleships to face the german fleet, those will be needed if we want to be able to keep control of our maritime sea routes for transport of materiel and troops.
An evolution of the Panzer II light tank
We believe that we can work off of our orginal panzers and create a new one that can counter enemy armored fighting vehicles, overall becoming a very useful design.
An evolution of the Panzer III tank
Our Infantry units could use more support from Infantry tanks, our engineers are ready to devolope a Panzer IV (the most common tank in the German Army).
An evolution of the Panzer IV tank
An evolution of the Panzer IV Ausf G tank
Russian T-34 and KV-1's are outclassing our Panzer IV and Panzer III designs, our engineers are ready to create a new design to counter their tanks.
Our Engineers are ready to create a powerful heavy tank design that will emphasize both Firepower and Armor.
An evolution of the Messerschmitt Bf 109E design.
An evolution of the Messerschmitt Bf 109F design.
Our engineers are ready to create a twin engine fighter, that will be much heavier then our BF-109s, able to take a lot more damage and deliver alot more firepower.
An evolution of the Bf 110 design.
The Junker Ju 88C is a heavy fighter version of the Ju 88A fast bomber.
The Heinkel He 219 Uhu ("Eagle-Owl") design is very sophisticated, it will include an advanced VHF-band intercept radar and the first operational use of ejection seat.

If cities defense become stronger or if your medium bombers are starting to take to much damages facing enemy fighters, new bombers with bigger payload and powerful defensive armament will be needed. Completing this project will allow the construction of modern Heavy Bombers.
Our earlier made light tanks lack a strong main gun, the Tetrarch will be designed to fit a 2 pounder cannon which will drastically improve our armored divisions.
Going off of the Vickers MK VI, we believe we can create a better infantry tank armed with a better vickers machine gun.
Based upon prior tank designs, our engineers think they will be able to devolope a new advanced light tank to match other modern tank designs.
A new suspension system is available to make our cruiser tanks go faster, our engineers are ready to design a cruiser tank to fit with the new suspension system.
Our Enginers are ready to create a new Infantry Support Tank.
Our Engineers are ready to create a better armor replacement for the Cruiser IV tank.
Our Engineers are ready to create a faster and strong Cruiser tank to counter enemy Panzer III and Panzer IV tanks.

This design is based on the US M4 Sherman on which the deadly british 17 pounder anti-tank gun will be mounted.

An evolution of the Spitfire design.
Designed from the beginning as a light unarmed bomber, the Mosquito will surely be one of the fastest available aircraft, allowing it to avoid interception before being able to reach it's target.
Our Engineers are ready to create our second heavy bomber that will be very effective in night raids.
Our army could use an advanced light tank to support our infantry on the battlefield, this is the solution.
Our army lacks a modern tank that can compare to other nation's tanks, our engineers copying other nations designs are ready to devolope the M-11-39.

Our military lacks medium tanks to fight other tanks, the M3 Grant will be our solution.

Based upon prior tank preformances in Europe and Africa, our engineers have come up with a modern tank design (the most common tank in the American Army).
British use of the Sherman in North Africa has proved itself on the battlefield, we can make it better by mounting a 76 mm gun and a higher caliber machine gun.
Our Engineers have planned an improved Sherman hull based off of information from the front, this will improve the Sherman's ability to take a hit.

Our generals have proposed to assemble a force of airborn divisions to secure the area around Narvik in Norway. Once the taskforce will be assembled, the assault will be launched immediatly if we have already declared war to Norway and Denmark, or when it will start, before French and British troops take the initiative there. They suggest to deploy a close naval support for those troops.

After France, we must invade U.K. to eliminate all menace from the west before expanding to the east. The operation our generals are now planing is far more ambitious than any initial proposal, with the creation of two complete amphibious armies and numerous Fallschirmjagerdivision. Once completed this operation will only be launched if France has surrendered.

British Generals have suggested a plan to knock the Axis out of Africa, with the Allied army in the east we can crush the Italian, Vichy and German troops between our two armies. This plan will liberate many Vichy held cities and return them to Free France.

HMS Hood (pennant number 51) was the last battlecruiser built for the Royal Navy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] One of four Admiral-class battlecruisers ordered in mid-1916, her design—although drastically revised after the Battle of Jutland and improved while she was under construction—still had serious limitations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] For this reason she was the only ship of her class to be completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She was named after the 18th-century Admiral Samuel Hood.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] When war with Germany was declared in September 1939, Hood was operating in the area around Iceland, and spent the next several months hunting between Iceland and the Norwegian Sea for German commerce raiders and blockade runners.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] After a brief overhaul to her engine plant, she sailed as the flagship of Force H, and participated in the destruction of the French Fleet at Mers-el-Kebir.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Relieved as flagship of Force H, Hood was dispatched to Scapa Flow, and operated in the area as a convoy escort and later as a defence against a potential German invasion fleet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In May 1941, she and the battleship HMS Prince of Wales were ordered to intercept the German battleship Bismarck which was en route to attack convoys in the Atlantic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] On 24 May 1941, Hood was struck by several German shells early in the Battle of the Denmark Strait and exploded; the loss had a profound effect on the British.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Prime Minister Winston Churchill ordered the Royal Navy to "sink the Bismarck", and they fulfilled his command on 26–27 May.

Littorio was a Vittorio Veneto-class battleship that served in the Regia Marina during World War II.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] On 30 July 1943, after the fall of Benito Mussolini, Littorio was renamed Italia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Armistice between Italy and Allied armed forces took place on 8 September, along with the rest of the Italian fleet she was formally surrendered to the Allies on the following day.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She was stationed in the Great Bitter Lake in Egypt until the end of the war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Littorio participated in 46 war missions, nine of which were enemy hunting and three were as an escort.

USS Iowa (BB-61) was the lead ship of her class of battleship and the fourth in the United States Navy to be named in honor of the 29th state.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Owing to the cancellation of the Montana-class battleships, Iowa is the last lead ship of any class of United States battleships, and was the only ship of her class to have served in the Atlantic Ocean during World War II.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Iowa was decommissioned for the last time in 1990, and was initially struck from the Naval Vessel Register in 1995.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She was reinstated from 1999 to 2006 to comply with federal laws that required retention and maintenance of two Iowa-class battleships.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Iowa is currently berthed with the National Defense Reserve Fleet at Suisun Bay, near San Francisco, California, and is awaiting donation to a not-for-profit entity for use as a museum ship.

The Richelieu class battleships were the last and largest battleships of the French Navy, staying in service into the 1960s.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Designed in the 1930s to counter of threat of the Italian Vittorio Veneto class battleships, the Richelieu class were essentially scaled-up versions of the preceding Dunkerque class, featuring a main armament of eight 380 mm guns in two quadruple turrets in forward superfiring positions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Four Richelieu class ships, of three different subclasses, were laid down over the course of three naval construction programs, in 1935, 1936, and 1938. Only the two first units, Richelieu and Jean Bart, were ever completed, and saw service during World War II, first under Vichy control in Dakar (1940) and Casablanca (1942), then under the Allies' control, Richelieu participating in British Home Fleet and Eastern Fleet operations, and supported the French forces return to Indochina in late 1945.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Jean Bart was not completed until the 1950s, and took part in the operations off Port Saïd (Egypt) during the Suez Crisis in 1956.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Both were scrapped in the late 1960s.

The Dunkerque was the first of a new class of warship of the French Navy labeled as a "fast battleship".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Not as well-armed and considerably less armoured than contemporary battleships, they are nonetheless considered scaled-down battleships and they are considerably more balanced (in the ship's performance tradeoffs between armour and armament) than battlecruisers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Dunkerques were superior in all respects to and designed to counter the threat of the German pocket battleships of the Deutschland class, which were in effect scaled-up cruisers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She was scuttled, along with Strasbourg, on 27 November 1942 in Toulon.

Yamato, named after the ancient Japanese Yamato Province, was the lead ship of the Yamato class of battleships that served with the Imperial Japanese Navy during World War II.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She and her sister ship, Musashi, "were the largest and most powerful battleships ever built", displacing 72,800 tonnes at full load and armed with nine 46 cm (18.1 inch) main guns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Neither survived the war.

Bismarck was the first of two Bismarck-class battleships built for the German Kriegsmarine during World War II.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The ship was named after Chancellor Otto von Bismarck, the primary force behind the German unification in 1871.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Along with her sister ship Tirpitz, Bismarck was the largest battleship ever built by Germany, and the heaviest built by any European power.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Bismarck conducted only one offensive operation, codenamed Rheinübung, in May 1941.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The ship, along with the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen, was to break out into the Atlantic Ocean and raid Allied shipping from North America to Great Britain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The two ships were detected several times off Scandinavia, however, and British naval units were deployed to block their route.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] At the Battle of Denmark Strait, Bismarck engaged and destroyed the battlecruiser HMS Hood, the pride of the Royal Navy, and forced the battleship HMS Prince of Wales to retreat with heavy damage, although in the end Bismarck herself was hit three times and suffered an oil leak from a ruptured tank following the hits. The destruction of Hood spurred a relentless pursuit by the Royal Navy with dozens of warships involved.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Two days later, while steaming for the relative safety of occupied France, Bismarck was attacked by Fairey Swordfish torpedo bombers from the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal; one hit was scored that jammed the battleship's steering gear and rendered her unmanoeuvrable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The following morning, Bismarck suffered heavy damage from the battleships HMS King Georges V and HMS Rodney, she was scuttled by her crew and in June 1989, Robert Ballard discovered the location of Bismarck's wreck.

Gangut was both the lead ship of the Gangut-class battleships of the Imperial Russian Navy built before World War I and the last of her class to be completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Ganguts were the first class of Russian dreadnoughts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She was named after the Russian victory over the Swedish Navy in the Battle of Gangut in 1714.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She was reconstructed between 1931 and 1934 with new boilers, fire-control systems and greatly enlarged superstructures.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] During the Winter War she bombarded Finnish coastal artillery positions one time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Her anti-aircraft armament was greatly reinforced in early 1941, just before Operation Barbarossa.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] She provided gunfire support against the Germans during the Siege of Leningrad despite being bombed three times and under repair for a year.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Retained on active duty after the war, she became a training ship in 1954 before being struck off the Navy List in 1956 and slowly scrapped.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] On 22 July 1944 she was awarded the Order of the Red Banner.

The dreadnought was the predominant type of 20th-century battleship.[NEWLINE] The first of the kind, the Royal Navy's Dreadnought had such an impact when launched in 1906 that battleships built after her were referred to as 'dreadnoughts', and earlier battleships became known as pre-dreadnoughts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Her design had two revolutionary features: an 'all-big-gun' armament scheme and steam turbine propulsion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The arrival of the dreadnoughts renewed the naval arms race, principally between the United Kingdom and Germany but reflected worldwide, as the new class of warships became a crucial symbol of national power.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The term 'dreadnought' gradually dropped from use after World War I, especially after the Washington Naval Treaty, as all remaining battleships shared dreadnought characteristics; it can also be used to describe battlecruisers, the other type of ship resulting from the dreadnought revolution.

The South Dakota-class was a group of four fast battleships built by the United States Navy. They were the second class of battleships to be named after the 40th State; the first class was designed in the 1920s and canceled under the terms of the Washington Naval Treaty. The class comprised four ships: South Dakota, Indiana, Massachusetts, and Alabama. They were more compact and better protected than the preceding North Carolina class, but had the same main battery, nine 16-inch (406 mm)/45-caliber guns in triple turrets. The ships can be visually distinguished from the earlier vessels by their single funnel, compared to twin funnels in the North Carolinas. According to authors William Garzke and Robert Dulin, the South Dakota design was the best "treaty battleship" ever built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Construction began shortly before World War II, with Fiscal Year (FY) 1939 appropriations. Commissioning through the summer of 1942, the four ships served in both the Atlantic, ready to intercept possible German capital ship sorties. As the U.S. went on the offensive in the Central Pacific, they joined in escorting the fast carrier task forces, a job for which their heavy anti-aircraft gun batteries were well-suited. They also employed their main battery guns in shore bombardment, and were kept ready to form battle line in case their Japanese opposite numbers should appear. All four ships were retired post-war; South Dakota and Indiana were scrapped, while Massachusetts and Alabama were retained as museum ships.

The Scharnhorst class were the first capital ships, alternatively referred to as battlecruisers or battleships, built for the German Navy (Kriegsmarine) after World War I. The class comprised two vessels: the lead ship Scharnhorst and Gneisenau.[NEWLINE]Scharnhorst was launched first, and so she is considered to be the lead ship by some sources; however, they are also referred to as the Gneisenau class in some other sources, as Gneisenau was the first to be laid down and commissioned. They marked the beginning of German naval rearmament after the Treaty of Versailles.[NEWLINE]The ships were armed with nine 28 cm (11 in) SK C/34 guns in three triple turrets, though there were plans to replace these weapons with six 38 cm (15 in) SK C/34 guns in twin turrets.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The two ships were laid down in 1935, launched in late 1936, and commissioned into the German fleet by early 1939. Scharnhorst and Gneisenau operated together for much of the early portion of World War II, including sorties into the Atlantic to raid British merchant shipping. The two ships participated in Operation Weserübung, the German invasion of Norway. During operations off Norway, the two ships engaged the battlecruiser HMS Renown and sank the aircraft carrier HMS Glorious— in the engagement with Glorious, Scharnhorst achieved one of the longest-range naval gunfire hits in history. In early 1942, the two ships made a daylight dash up the English Channel from occupied France to Germany.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In late 1942, Gneisenau was heavily damaged in an Allied air raid against Kiel. In early 1943, Scharnhorst joined the Bismarck class battleship Tirpitz in Norway to interdict Allied convoys to the Soviet Union. Scharnhorst and several destroyers sortied from Norway to attack a convoy; the Germans were instead intercepted by British naval patrols. During the battle of North Cape, the Royal Navy battleship HMS Duke of York sank Scharnhorst. In the meantime, repair work on Gneisenau had begun, and the ship was in the process of being rearmed. However, when Scharnhorst was sunk, work on her sister was abandoned. Instead, she was sunk as a blockship in Gdynia in 1945; the wreck was broken up for scrap in the 1950s.

At the begining of the war, it was clear that the French and the British Armies didn't have enough materials to do a long war against Germany. They turned to the USA for help providing war material, and despite the USA were a neutral nation, Roosevelt signed a pact to authorize to give materials to their future allies. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] They started to send material and equipments by sea to supply the United Kingdom, but rapidly the KriegsMarine brought her submarines to attack the isolated transports crossing the Atlantic ocean. To avert the danger, the allies started to form convoys of transport ships protected by destroyers and other escort ships, and material was brought more safely to its destination. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Convoys were also used in the Pacific and the Indian oceans by the allies and the axis to transport troops and material, and even to North Sea where Germans brought Iron coming from Sweden via Narvik.

Greek infantry was neither advanced nor numerous, and its military had suffered recent casualties from numerous wars against its neighbour, Turkey. This recent exposure to military action provided the front line infantry with operational experience. That knowledge, and their great devotion to protecting Greece from invaders, made them an effective fighting force.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] When Fascist Italy invaded from Albania, Greek troops showed their strength and determination by forcing the Italians back across the Albanian border. Unfortunately for the Greeks, Hitler wanted to protect his ally’s reputation, and Germany invaded Greece on 6 April 1941, conquering the country within a month.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Throughout the occupation, Greek resistance sprung up numerous times even managing to liberate several mountainous regions from German occupation. Unfortunately, large scale resistance beyond that was limited due to civil conflict between the different factions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The government in exile formed armed forces and, fighting alongside the British, engaged the Axis troops in North Africa, the Middle East, and Italy.

At the end of the Great War, Britain found itself wanting in regards to the number of soldiers in its military, as close to a million had been lost. At the outbreak of the Second World War Britain had a small army compared to other nations (9 available divisions compared to Germany’s 78 and France’s 86), and after declaring war on Germany, the British Expeditionary Force (BEF) was dispatched to France.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] After the fall of France, most of the remaining BEF was rescued from Dunkirk by the British Navy and civilian craft. The British would continue to engage the Axis forces on many fronts, including Greece, North Africa, Sicily, Italy, Norway, Malaya, Singapore, and Burma.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] British troops would also take part during the D-Day landings, storming beaches Sword and Gold, and continuing on against German forces throughout Northern France, The Low Countries, and Germany itself.

At the outbreak of the Second World War, France had the largest army in Europe, sporting 86 divisions. After Germany declared war on Poland, and France’s subsequent declaration of war on Germany, the first few months were spend by the infantry relaxing. They entered into Germany against little resistance, but shortly left. With the exception of fighting in Norway, they then sat and waited during the time known as the Phoney War, snug in their Maginot Line fortifications. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In the spring of 1940, the French were outflanked by the Wehrmacht, who attacked through the Low Countries, completely ignoring the Maginot Line defenses. Although the French infantry fought fiercely, they were unprepared for the new armoured tactics devised by Germany, and soon they were routed and Paris was captured.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The war was not over for the French infantry, however. Although many of the survivors of the Battle of France remained in the military under Vichy Rule and some even joined the S.S., there were those who joined the Free French forces outside of the country, eventually reaching 400,000 volunteers. Under the command of General Charles de Gaul, La France Libre forces continued to do battle against the Axis forces, engaging them in Crete, Libya, Tunisia, East Africa, and Italy. After D-Day, they once again fought on their home soil, and battled through Belgium into Germany.

As the Doughboys returned home at the end of the Great War, the 500,000-strong National Army was disbanded and the United States of America would sit through the interwar years with a relatively small Regular Army of about 175,000. As war broke out in Europe for the second time that century, the United States attempted to remain neutral, again. As the war escalated, it seemed that America would not be able to maintain its neutrality and would be drawn into another war in Europe. So, a slow military build-up began. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] On "December 7th, 1941 - a date which will live in infamy - the United States of America was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan." Overnight, America was embroiled in a war with Japan. Four days later, Adolph Hitler declared war on the U.S.A., pulling the isolationist nation into the war in Europe, as well. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] In response to this sudden state of war, a new National Army was formed as a successor to the one that had been disbanded. Armed with the trusty M1 Garand, a strong national pride, and a new helmet design (replacing the old British version), the American Infantry would engage the enemy all over the globe, from Tunisia and Guadalcanal to Monte Casino, Iwo Jima, and Normandy.

The Renault R35, an abbreviation of Char léger Modèle 1935 R or R 35, was a French light infantry tank of the Second World War.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Designed from 1933 and produced from 1936, the type was intended as a light infantry support tank, equipping autonomous tank battalions, that would be allocated to individual infantry divisions to assist them in executing offensive operations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] To this end it was relatively well-armoured but slow and lacking a good antitank-capacity, fitted with a short 37 mm gun.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The R 35 was intended to replace the FT 17 as standard light infantry tank from the summer of 1936, but even by May 1940 not enough conscripts had been retrained and therefore eight battalions of the older tank had to be kept operational.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] On 1 September 1939, at the outbreak of war, 975 vehicles had been delivered out of 1070 produced; 765 were fielded by tank battalions in France, 49 used for drive training, 33 were in depot and 45 present in the colonies.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Of a total order for 2,300 at least 1,601 had been produced until 1 June 1940 — the numbers for that month are lacking — but 245 had been exported: to Poland (50), Turkey (100; two batches of fifty each in February and March 1940), Romania (41 from an order for 200), and Yugoslavia (54).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

The SOMUA S35 was a French Cavalry tank of the Second World War.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Built from 1936 until 1940 to equip the armoured divisions of the Cavalry, it was for its time a relatively agile medium-weight tank, superior in armour and armament to both its French and foreign competitors, such as the contemporary versions of the German Panzerkampfwagen III.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] It was constructed from well-sloped, mainly cast, armour sections, that however made it expensive to produce and time-consuming to maintain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] During the German invasion of May 1940, the SOMUA S35 proved itself to be a tactically effective type, but this was negated by strategic mistakes in deploying its units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] After the defeat of France in June 1940, limiting production to a number of 430, captured SOMUA S35s were used by the Axis powers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] A derived type, the SOMUA S40, with an improved suspension, lowered hull cast and welded turret armour, had been planned to replace the original version on the production lines in July 1940.

The Char B1 was a French heavy tank manufactured before World War II.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Char B1 was a specialised heavy break-through vehicle, originally conceived as a self-propelled gun with a 75 mm howitzer in the hull;[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] later a 47 mm gun in a turret was added, to allow it to function also as a Char de Bataille, a "battle tank" fighting enemy armour, equipping the armoured divisions of the Infantry Arm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Among the most powerfully armed and armoured tanks of its day, the type was very effective in direct confrontations with German armour in 1940 during the Battle of France, but slow speed and high fuel consumption made it ill-adapted to the war of movement then being fought.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] After the defeat of France, captured Char B1 (bis) would be used by Germany with some rebuilt as flamethrowers or mechanised artillery.

The Panzer I was a light tank produced in Germany in the 1930s. The name is short for the German Panzerkampfwagen I (armored fighting vehicle mark I), abbreviated PzKpfw I. The tank's official German ordnance inventory designation was SdKfz 101 (special purpose vehicle 101).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Design of the Panzer I began in 1932 and mass production in 1934. Intended only as a training tank to introduce the concept of armored warfare to the German Army, the Panzer I saw combat in Spain during the Spanish Civil War, in Poland, France, the Soviet Union and North Africa during the Second World War, and in China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Experiences with the Panzer I during the Spanish Civil War helped shape the German armored corps' invasion of Poland in 1939 and France in 1940.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] By 1941, the Panzer I chassis design was used for production of tank destroyers and assault guns. There were attempts to upgrade the Panzer I throughout its service history, including by foreign nations to extend the design lifespan. It continued to serve in the armed forces of Spain until 1954.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Panzer I's performance in combat was limited by its thin armor and light armament of two general purpose machine guns. As a design intended for training, the Panzer I was not as capable as other light tanks of the era, such as the T-26.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Although weak in combat, it formed a large portion of Germany's tank strength in numbers and was used in all major campaigns between September 1939 and December 1941. The small, vulnerable light tank would be surpassed in importance by better-known German tanks such as the Panzer IV, Panther, and Tiger.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Nevertheless, the Panzer I's contribution to the early victories of Nazi Germany during the Second World War was significant.

The Panzer II was the common name for a family of German tanks used in World War II. The official German designation was Panzerkampfwagen II (abbreviated PzKpfw II).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Although the vehicle had originally been designed as a stopgap while more advanced tanks were developed, it nonetheless went on to play an important role in the early years of World War II, during the Polish and French campaigns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] By the end of 1942 it had been largely removed from front line service, and production of the tank itself ceased by 1943. Its chassis remained in use as the basis of several other armored vehicles.

The Panzerkampfwagen IV (Tank Mark IV), otherwise known as the Panzer IV, was a medium infantry support tank used by Germany and its allies during the Second World War. It was the most produced German tank during the war, with more than 8,800 produced.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The first models were infantry support tanks, armed with stubby 75mm KwK L/24. As the Panzer III became increasingly obsolete, the Wehrmacht needed a tank that could fight other tank effectively. The F2 and G models had not only Anti-tank guns (KwK L/43 on the F2, a KwK L/48 on the G) that had better armor penetration than the F-32 gun on the Soviet T-34/76, the armor was upgraded as well. A further variant, the H had side skirts to protect against small arms and explosives. Late in the war, the Panzer IVH was proven to be inferior to the Panther and Tiger, but still a capable adversary.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] While production was stopped in late 1944, they were used up until the very end of the war. The chassis was the base for many Tank Destroyers, SPGs, and Anti-Aircraft guns. The last known usage of the Panzer IV was during the Six-Day War (1967) by the Syrians.
